definition: to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon
to exchange/to change (clothes etc)/to substitute/to switch/to convert (currency)

sentences.english: So now let me just do some grade school substitution.
sentences.chinese: 接下來做一些簡單的代換。

sentences.english: This article says the methods of solving acme kinds of second derivative calculus equations, through substituting variables.
sentences.chinese: 通過交量代換法給出幾類解二階微分方程的解法。

sentences.english: It is convenient to nondimensionalize this problem with the following substitutions .
sentences.chinese: 利用下面的代換，便於使這個問題無量綱化。

definition: please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
(jocularly) public building that has been lying idle (and is thus ideal for housing mosquitos) (Tw)
lit. Lord Ye's passion for dragons (idiom)/fig. to pretend to be fond of sth while actually fearing it/ostensible fondness of sth one really fears
lit. to assess the head and discuss the feet (idiom); minute criticism of a woman's appearance/fig. to find fault in minor details/nitpicking/overcritical
all crows are black (idiom)/evil people are bad all over the world
pinyin: tian1 xia4 wu1 ya1 yi1 ban1 hei1

definition: to patch up one's lie (when inconsistencies appear)/to cover (for sb who has lied)
(idiom) to have one's words turn out to be (tragically) prophetic
to return something to its rightful owner
